episode_title: 321 - The One With A Chick. And A Duck

content.description: Outside Central Perk, Rachel and Phoebe are helping Monica learn how to roller skate by rolling her between themselves.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So who’s idea was it to put everybody in the diner on skates?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, some idiot customer put a suggestion in the suggestion box.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, they took my idea!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That was you?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Okay, here you go. (rolls her back to Rachel)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Rachel, I made you a cocoa.
[He distracts her from catching Monica and Monica slams into her, knocking her down. Monica then falls on top of her.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, are you guys okay?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Are you all right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my.
content.parenthetical: leaving Central Perk and seeing Monica laying on top of Rachel who is moaning in pain.

content.text: (They both turn and give him a dirty look.)

content.description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is watching Quincy M.E. as Chandler is walking into the living room from his bedroom.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey. Y’know with that goatee you kinda look like Satan.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, so that’s why the priest threw holy water on me. (there’s no reaction from Joey) Okay, listen, you have to cheer up! Okay? You should come out with Ross and me, I mean anything is better than sitting around here crying all day about Kate.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey I was crying because, because nobody believed Quincy’s theory. Okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m gonna be on TV!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No way!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! They’re putting together this panel to talk about these fossils they just found in Peru and The Discovery Channel’s gonna film it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God! Who’s gonna watch that?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks. You ready to go?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. (they start to leave)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Saw a girl with that vest.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks. (He takes off the vest and throws it on the floor.)

content.speaker: Anchorwoman
content.text: While most of us think of chocolate bunnies and baskets as traditional Easter gifts. Some people insist on giving live chicks as presents. (Joey is intrigued by the idea) Unfortunately, the sad fact remains that most of these little guys won’t live to see the fourth of July. (Joey starts to call a place to buy a little baby chick) Because of as a result of improper care, they will be dead.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, hi. You guys got any of those baby chicks? ‘Cause I was watching this ah, commercial on TV and man, those guys are cute!

content.description: The Moondance Diner: Pete is entering, Monica is on roller skates.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi! Hey, Pete you’re back! Hey, check this out. (She starts to skate over to him)

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Wow! Skates!
(She gets just about all the way over to him and falls into his arms.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! You’re a lot sturdier that Chandler. He crumpled like a piece of paper. So how was you’re trip?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Well… (he holds up a gift he brought her)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, what’d ya bring me?! (She opens the gift) Awww, hotel toiletries from Japan. Oh, these are gonna go in my permanent collection. You want some coffee?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Yeah, sure, that’d be great.
(She starts to go and get the coffee and falls behind the counter.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Regular or decaf?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Ah, which ever is closest.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (hands him a cup)

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: So ask me what I did today.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So what did you do today Pete?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: I bought a restaurant and I would like you to be the head chef.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! Oh.(She turns around quickly and falls)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is telling Rachel about Pete’s offer.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Can you believe he just offered me a restaurant?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What a jerk! You want me to kick his ass?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I mean this has been like my dream since I got my first Easy Bake Oven and opened Easy Monica’s Bakery. I mean I would kill for this job. I mean I can totally do this job, and God knows I paid my dues. (She removes her fake breasts) But Pete’s just doing this because he has a crush on me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And you’re still not attracted to him at all?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hmm, no. I mean how can I accept a restaurant from him? I-I-I-I can’t. I couldn’t even accept a necklace from Stu Vincent in the seventh grade.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, but Mon that’s totally different. He was you’re health teacher.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, please.
(She slaps Rachel’s side and Rachel screams in pain.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? Honey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I am, my side still hurts from when you crashed into me yesterday.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God, I’m so sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know.
(Monica hugs her goes and hugs her)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ow!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, you guys! Guess what?
content.parenthetical: entering, wearing a white suit with a little red bow tie

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Got a job on a river boat?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what I didn’t wear this suit for a year because you hated it. Well, guess what? You’re not my girlfriend anymore so…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh I see, so this suit is making a point.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now that you’re on you’re own, you’re free to look as stupid as you like.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You like it right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh absolutely. I like it even more on you than I did on Colonel Sanders. (Ross starts to leave) Ross! Ross! I’m kidding!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, come here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What-what was it you were gonna tell us?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Oh! Was how you invented the cotton gin?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, good bye! (leaves)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is talking to Phoebe about her suggestion.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So um, after you put the suggestion in the box, how long did it take for the roller skating thing to happen.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, oh, about three months.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, so I guess that’s about ah, two weeks before the topless thing kicks in.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I got you something! Open it! Open it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (He opens it and it’s a baby chick) It’s a chicken.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s cute, huh?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa, you guys, do you know anything about chicks?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fowl? No. Women? Nooo.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, well they are a huge responsibility, especially at this age. They require constant care. They-they need just the right food, and lot’s and lot’s of love.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, well no problem there. (He picks up the chick, hugs it really tight, and talks to it like it’s a little baby.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Easy Lenny.

content.description: The Moondance Diner, Pete is talking to Monica about the restaurant.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: So? I mean have you thought about it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Here’s the thing.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Oh no, not the thing. I hate the thing. What’s the thing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t do it. I’m sorry, I wish I could, but umm, see you have these feelings for me…

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Wait, wait, wait, wait, that’s-that’s what you’re worried about? If that’s the problem, we’ve got no problem.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: No! Look, I was gonna tell you this over dinner, but I met somebody else. On my trip.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Her name’s Ann, she’s a journalist. Ahh, we met on the plane. She asked me if she could finish off my peanuts, I thought she said something else, we had a big laugh. Yeah, I just, I mean I got, I got tired of waiting.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, that’s great! I mean I’m-I’m sorry, but I’m so happy for you. And now I can work for you!

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: I guess you can.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! Oh, this is incredible! Ohh! (she rolls over and kisses him on the cheek) All right, y’know what? I’m just gonna roll right into that office and-and quit!

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (she gets ready to go) Can you give me a little push?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Yeah, sure. Good luck!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m quitting!! Woo-hoo! (She rolls through a doorway and out of sight. We then hear a big crash, and see Monica roll past the door the other way.) I’m okay!! I’m all right!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! That’s exciting, you went to Japan, made up a woman.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m just saying, this woman, I mean she’s fictitious. No?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Why would you say that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ‘Cause you’re still into Monica. So you told her there was somebody else so she would agree to work with you, so ‘cause you figure oh if you spent a lot of time together, maybe something might happen, and…

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: You’re good. You’re good!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, no, I’m fairly intuitive and psychic. It’s a substantial gift.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Listen, can you promise me that you won’t tell her though?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Absolutely, oh I promise. Tell her what?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Thanks a lot.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No I’m serious. I mean I’m intuitive, but my memory sucks.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is baby-chick sitting.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, but this is the last time. (singing) With a chick-chick here, and a chick-chick there. Here a chick, there a chick, everywhere a chick-chick-(Joey enters)-chickeeeen.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How’s she doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well yeah, don’t-don’t you think it’s a she?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know. (He picks the chick up and turns it over, trying to determine the sex of the chick, and blows on it.) I can’t tell, what ever it was went back in too quickly.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, anyway, I got to go change, I’m ah, meeting some of the cast for drinks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I stayed home from work today while you were at rehearsal so somebody could be here with our chick!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Who was up from 2 o’clock this morning until 5 o’clock this morning trying to get her back to sleep?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You don’t think I get up when you get up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohhh, here it comes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, here it comes! I’m stuck here all day, and then you come in and spend two seconds with us and then expect to go off gallivanting with your friends? Well I don’t think so mister!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!! I need to relax! Okay? I was working all day!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And you don’t think taking care of our chick is work?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s not what I said. Okay, I just meant…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know what you meant!! (pause) You notice that ever since we got this chick, we’ve been fighting a lot more than we used too?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know, maybe we weren’t ready to have a chick.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll take her back tomorrow.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do you think we’ll get our three bucks back?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohhh, hey! All right, listen, I-I have that TV thing in like two hours, and I need your help, okay? What do you think? (takes out two suits) This blue suit, or this brown one?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, the brown one brings out your eyes, but your butt looks great in the blue one.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really? (Joey gives him a ‘Like I would know’ look)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is trying to take some aspirin.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oww! (She grabs the bottle, but has trouble opening it. She pops the top off and aspirins fly all over the place as Ross enters.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! That aspirin dance really works!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oww!
content.parenthetical: She bends over to try and pick up the aspirin

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God, is that still…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m fine, I’m fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No you’re not.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes I am!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look, I’m fine. Watch. (She picks up an aspirin between her toes) Look at that. (She lifts her leg to grab the aspirin with her hand and almost falls over.) Whoa-whoa!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay. Look, you have got to go to a doctor! Okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. I have got to get ready and go to a dinner at my bosses house. It’s a very big deal, there’s a lot of people there I have to meet.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And I’m sure you’re gonna make a big impression. Hi! I’m Rachel Green. It’s nice to meet you. (He lifts his leg and imitates shaking hands with it, just like how Rachel was trying to pick up the aspirin with her feet.) Come on, you probably have a broken rib!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I will go to the hospital tomorrow, it’ll still be broken then.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But y’know, I could use a hand getting ready.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rachel…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look, either help me or go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine. I’ll go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, but before you go, could you help me first?
content.parenthetical: with a hurt expression on her face

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure. I’ll help you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, good! Good! Do you guys know how to get a chick out of a VCR?!

content.description: Rachel’s bedroom, Rachel is trying to put on eye liner with her left hand, as Ross is setting out her shoes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what? I cannot do this with my left hand! Would you please, help me with this too?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh. (He drops the shoes, takes the brush from her, and licks the tip. He doesn’t like how it tastes.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Let’s use this brush. (Hands him another one.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. This stuff?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Careful. Light. Okay, do you know how, just sweep it across the lid. Okay? Just sweep it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oke-dokey. (He pokes her in the eye with the brush.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-ho!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! That’s just poking me in the eye!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry, I’m sorry. Close, close, close…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, just sweep it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sweeping…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sweep, sweep…(He starts to paint it on her eye, making it look like she has a black eye.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, now make it even, ‘cause we don’t…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We don’t want it-it to be too much, we want it to be subtle.
(Of course it’s too late for that.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. No, y’know you don’t, you don’t wear enough of this. (Rachel is shocked) What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Since when, since when do you think I don’t wear enough of this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I, close your eyes, I just think you’re gonna like this a little better, ‘cause, close-close… (He gets some more on the brush)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Blow it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry. ‘Cause umm, I think this will make you a little more sophisticated.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sophisticated like a hooker?

content.description: Central Perk, Monica is entering, Phoebe is already there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, guess what I’m doing tonight.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m checking out the restaurant with Pete.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, Monica, I am so excited for you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, I have to tell you something.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But I can’t tell you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, but wouldn’t it be easier if you had to tell me something that you could tell me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, sure in a perfect world. But, no, I promised I wouldn’t tell, and I swore to like all my gods.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Does it have to do with Ross and Rachel?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Does it have to do with Joey?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Does it have to do with-with Chandler and that sock that he keeps by his bed?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, but let’s come back to that later!

content.description: Rachel’s Bedroom, Ross is finishing up her make-up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There you go! Good enough for your party, huh?
(She turns and looks in the mirror, and it’s way, way over done. She looks like she has two black eyes.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yep?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure, I’ll just sit next to the trans-sexual from purchasing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, come on! All right, I gotta go! So good luck at the party. Okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wait, Ross, would you just stay and help me get dressed?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure, okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Okay, great! Umm, okay, just turn around.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t want you to see me naked!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rachel, I’ve seen you naked a million times. I ate hot fudge off you naked. Remember, I-I sucked that mini-marshmallow out of your belly button?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, but that was different. Y’know? I mean, we were, we were going out then, now I think it’s weird.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, y’know I can see you naked any time I want.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All I have to do is close my eyes. See? (closes his eyes) Woo-hoo!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross! Stop that!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on! I don’t want you thinking of me like that any more!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ahh, sorry, nothing you can do about it. It’s one of my ah, rights as the ex-boyfriend. (closes his eyes again) Oop, oh yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Stop it! Cut it out! Cut it out!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay, I’m sorry, it will never happen… (closes eyes) Uh-oh! Wait a minute! Wait-wait, now there are a hundred of you and I’m the king.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Rosss…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, would you grow up? It’s no big deal.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right. (She starts to take off her robe) Fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yowzah!!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: O-kay!! See what you did, I’m gonna be doing it by myself now. Okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aww, come on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s it. (She crawls onto the bed) Ow!!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-ow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ow! Ow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Easy. Easy. You have to go to the hospital. Okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I really do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I’m gonna get your coat and then I’ll-I’ll put you in a cab.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Oh wait, wait-wait, you’re not gonna come with me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of course I am. I just have to make a call.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay? (goes into the living room)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. (She goes to take off her make-up and screams in pain) Oww!!!! God!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! I wh-, what’s wrong?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry, I just can’t go to the hospital lookin’ like this.

content.description: Central Perk, Monica is trying to find out what Phoebe won’t tell her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Does it involve travel?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Noo!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Does it involve clogs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, wait, wait. Clogs, or claws?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Clogs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Claws?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, so it doesn’t involve Ross or Rachel or Chandler or Joey. But, what about Pete?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is it?! What about Pete?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know! (frantically points at Monica)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I feel like I’m talking to Lassie. All right, Phoebe would you just tell me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I gotta go. (gets up)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I, but you’re so close! No!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, does it involve something to do with Pete’s computer company?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, just go. You’re never gonna get it!

content.description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is watching Baywatch with the baby chick. He’s on one leather chair, the chick is on the other. It’s watching Yasmine Bleeth run and is chirping.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know. See, yes. That’s Yasmine Bleeth, she’s a completely different kind of chick. I love you both. But in very different ways.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohhh. (sees he still has the chick) Ahh! What are you doing?! I thought you were gonna take her back to the store today.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I did! But the store wouldn’t take her back! So then I took her to the shelter, and you know what I found out?
(Joey wants to know, but Chandler doesn’t want to discuss it by the chick, so he and Joey move over to the windows and away from the chick.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If they can’t find a home for her, they kill her! And I’m not gonna let that happen to little Yasmine!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, good, good, good, ‘cause, good, ‘cause I was kinda having second thoughts too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. And it’s not just chicks y’know? It’s all kinds of other animals!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s horrible! Well, you did the right thing man.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks, I’m glad you see it that way.
(He hear a duck start quacking, and see it waddle into the living room from the bathroom. Joey wants to know what’s with the duck.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohhh-hoo, funny story!

content.description: Pete’s Restaurant’s Kitchen, Pete is showing Monica around the kitchen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t believe this! Wow, look at this refridgerator! It’s gigantic! I mean I could live in this thing! I’d be cold, but I’m always cold. Oh my God, look at these spider burners! I love spider burners.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: So you like it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, it is sooo perfect. Thank you so much. (runs over and hugs him)

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Oh, you’re welcome. (He takes a deep breath)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you just smell my hair?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Nooo. Uh-huh, no way. What? No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You still have feelings for me don’t you?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Now, nooo! I’m just excited about the restaurant, that’s all.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pete.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Okay, I love you. Is that so bad?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, it’s not bad. It’s not bad at all. It’s-it’s really nice.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Look, the only who stands to get hurt is me. And I’m okay with that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You may be okay about getting hurt, but I am not okay with being the one who hurts you. That’s why I can’t take this job.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And well, we probably shouldn’t see each other anymore. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Okay, yeah. I mean… If that’s, if that’s really what you want, okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, bye.
(She kisses him on the cheek, and he kisses her back on the mouth.)

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: I’m sorry things didn’t work out…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right shut up for a second and let me just see something. (She kisses him back on the lips) Oh, wow! (They then hug and kiss, very passionately.)

content.description: The Hallway Between The Apartments, Ross and Rachel are coming back from the hospital. Ross is helping her up the stairs.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, you’d tell me the truth. Right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, you can’t look fat in an x-ray.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.
(As they approach the door, Chandler comes out carrying his duck.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! Now you stay out here, and you think about what you did!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s a duck.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s a bad duck!!! (to Ross) How’d the thing go tonight, Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, it was, nah, well…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What thing? What thing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nothing, ah there was this thing at the museum. Come on. (they go into her apartment) Easy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, now when you come back I hope you remember that, that chick is not a toy! (He goes back into the apartment)
[cut to inside Monica and Rachel’s]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What thing? What is this thing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was kinda, supposed to be on TV tonight for The Discovery Channel .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, why didn’t you tell me that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Eh, ‘cause I knew that if I told you, you’d make me go, and I knew you needed someone to be with you tonight. Come on. Come on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I cannot believe you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is the sweetest thing, I just…
(They both look at each other for a while)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You should get some sleep.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, I’ll umm…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry I spoiled you’re evening.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, that’s, no, as long as you’re okay. So I’ll ah, I’ll see you tomorrow.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um-hmm, yeah.
(He leaves)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: See ya.
(In the hallway, Ross all dejected, sits down on the step.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What did you do?
content.parenthetical: coming out of his apartment and seeing Ross

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s Bathroom: Chandler is watching the duck swim in the bathtub.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What ‘cha doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Having a swim.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What about the chick?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Chicks don’t swim.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you sure?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know. Should we try it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure.
(Chandler picks up the chick and drops it in the water.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See, I told you they don’t swim. (He goes to take it out)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait. Give him a minute.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Noo! (takes him out) Oh, it’s okay, it’s okay, baby, baby, baby.
(Joey picks up and turns on a hair dryer.)
